title: Gives preference to service disabled veteran owned small businesses with respect to state contracts
summary: Gives preference to service disabled veteran owned small businesses with respect to state contracts.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ORTIZ,  LUPARDO, McDONOUGH, PERRY, CASTRO --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M.   of  A.  BARCLAY,  GUNTHER,  KOLB,  LATIMER,
         P. LOPEZ  --  read  once and referred to the Committee on Governmental
         Operations

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to state contract prefer-
         ence for service disabled veteran owned small businesses

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The executive law is amended by adding a new section 369 to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S  369.  STATE  CONTRACT PREFERENCE FOR SERVICE DISABLED VETERAN OWNED
    4  SMALL BUSINESSES. 1. LEGISLATIVE FINDINGS AND DETERMINATIONS. THE LEGIS-
    5  LATURE HEREBY FINDS AND DETERMINES THAT IT SHALL BE THE  POLICY  OF  THE
    6  STATE  OF  NEW YORK TO STRENGTHEN OPPORTUNITIES IN STATE CONTRACTING FOR
    7  SERVICE-DISABLED VETERAN OWNED SMALL BUSINESSES.
    8    THE LEGISLATURE HEREBY FURTHER FINDS  AND  DETERMINES  THAT  NEW  YORK
    9  STATE  SHOULD  HONOR THE EXTRAORDINARY SERVICE RENDERED TO OUR STATE AND
   10  THE UNITED STATES BY VETERANS WITH DISABILITIES INCURRED  OR  AGGRAVATED
   11  IN  THE  LINE  OF  DUTY  DURING  ACTIVE SERVICE WITH THE ARMED FORCES BY
   12  PROVIDING A CONTRACT PREFERENCE TO ALL  SERVICE-DISABLED  VETERAN  BUSI-
   13  NESSES.
   14    2.  DEFINITIONS.  WHEN USED IN THIS SECTION, THE FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL
   15  MEAN AND BE DEFINED AS FOLLOWS:
   16    (A) "AGENCY" MEANS ANY DEPARTMENT, BOARD,  BUREAU,  COMMISSION,  DIVI-
   17  SION,  OFFICE,  COUNCIL,  COMMITTEE OR OFFICER OF THE STATE, OR A PUBLIC
   18  BENEFIT CORPORATION OR PUBLIC AUTHORITY AT LEAST ONE OF WHOSE MEMBERS IS
   19  APPOINTED BY THE GOVERNOR, AUTHORIZED BY LAW TO MAKE RULES  OR  TO  MAKE
   20  FINAL  DECISIONS  IN  ADJUDICATORY PROCEEDINGS BUT SHALL NOT INCLUDE THE
   21  GOVERNOR, AGENCIES IN THE LEGISLATIVE AND  JUDICIAL  BRANCHES,  AGENCIES
   22  CREATED  BY  INTERSTATE COMPACT OR INTERNATIONAL AGREEMENT, THE DIVISION

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03634-01-1

       A. 70                               2

    1  OF MILITARY AND NAVAL AFFAIRS TO THE EXTENT IT EXERCISES  ITS  RESPONSI-
    2  BILITY FOR MILITARY AND NAVAL AFFAIRS, THE DIVISION OF STATE POLICE, THE
    3  IDENTIFICATION AND INTELLIGENCE UNIT OF THE DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE
    4  SERVICES,  THE  STATE  INSURANCE FUND, THE UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE APPEAL
    5  BOARD, AND EXCEPT FOR PURPOSES OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF SECTION TWO HUNDRED
    6  TWO-D OF THE STATE ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEDURE ACT,  THE  WORKERS'  COMPEN-
    7  SATION  BOARD AND EXCEPT FOR PURPOSES OF ARTICLE TWO OF THE STATE ADMIN-
    8  ISTRATIVE PROCEDURE ACT, THE STATE DIVISION OF PAROLE AND THE DEPARTMENT
    9  OF CORRECTIONAL SERVICES;
   10    (B) "SERVICE-DISABLED" MEANS, WITH RESPECT  TO  DISABILITY,  THAT  THE
   11  DISABILITY  WAS INCURRED OR AGGRAVATED IN THE LINE OF DUTY IN THE ACTIVE
   12  SERVICE IN THE UNITED STATES  ARMY,  NAVY,  AIR  FORCE,  MARINES,  COAST
   13  GUARD,  AND/OR  RESERVES THEREOF, AND/OR IN THE ARMY NATIONAL GUARD, AIR
   14  NATIONAL GUARD, NEW YORK GUARD AND/OR THE NEW YORK NAVAL MILITIA;
   15    (C) "SERVICE-DISABLED VETERAN" MEANS A VETERAN, WHO INCURRED OR AGGRA-
   16  VATED A DISABILITY IN THE LINE OF DUTY IN  THE  ACTIVE  SERVICE  IN  THE
   17  UNITED  STATES  ARMY,  NAVY,  AIR  FORCE,  MARINES,  COAST GUARD, AND/OR
   18  RESERVES THEREOF, AND/OR IN THE ARMY NATIONAL GUARD, AIR NATIONAL GUARD,
   19  NEW YORK GUARD AND/OR THE NEW YORK NAVAL MILITIA; AND
   20    (D)  "SERVICE-DISABLED  VETERAN  BUSINESS"  MEANS  A  SMALL   BUSINESS
   21  CONCERN,  EMPLOYING  LESS THAN ONE HUNDRED PERSONS, OWNED AND CONTROLLED
   22  BY SERVICE-DISABLED VETERAN OR VETERANS;
   23    3. CONTRACT PREFERENCES AND SET ASIDES. THE HEADS  OF  AGENCIES  SHALL
   24  PROVIDE  THE  OPPORTUNITY  FOR  SERVICE-DISABLED  VETERAN  BUSINESSES TO
   25  SIGNIFICANTLY INCREASE THE STATE CONTRACTING AND SUBCONTRACTING OF  SUCH
   26  BUSINESSES.   TO ACHIEVE THAT OBJECTIVE, SUCH AGENCIES SHALL ESTABLISH A
   27  GOAL OF NOT LESS THAN THREE PERCENT FOR PARTICIPATION  BY  SERVICE-DISA-
   28  BLED  VETERAN BUSINESSES IN STATE CONTRACTING, AND EACH AGENCY CONTRACT-
   29  ING OFFICER SHALL HAVE THE AUTHORITY TO RESERVE CERTAIN PROCUREMENTS FOR
   30  SERVICE-DISABLED VETERAN BUSINESSES IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE COMPLIANCE  WITH
   31  SUCH GOAL.
   32    4.  DUTIES  OF  AGENCY HEADS. IN ORDER TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS AND
   33  POLICY ESTABLISHED IN SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION, HEADS OF  AGEN-
   34  CIES SHALL:
   35    (A)  DEVELOP  A STRATEGY TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS AND POLICY ESTAB-
   36  LISHED IN SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION; AND SHALL PUBLICLY  PUBLISH
   37  SUCH STRATEGY;
   38    (B)  MAKE THE AGENCY'S STRATEGY PUBLICLY AVAILABLE, HAVE SUCH STRATEGY
   39  POSTED UPON THE WEBSITE OF SUCH  AGENCY;  AND  REPORT  ANNUALLY  TO  THE
   40  GOVERNOR,  THE  PRESIDENT  PRO TEMPORE OF THE SENATE, THE SPEAKER OF THE
   41  ASSEMBLY, THE CHAIR OF THE SENATE STANDING COMMITTEE ON VETERANS,  HOME-
   42  LAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS, AND THE CHAIR OF THE ASSEMBLY STAND-
   43  ING  COMMITTEE ON VETERANS AFFAIRS ON THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE AGENCY'S
   44  STRATEGY;
   45    (C) DESIGNATE A SENIOR-LEVEL OFFICIAL WITHIN SUCH AGENCY WHO SHALL  BE
   46  RESPONSIBLE FOR DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING THE AGENCY'S STRATEGY;
   47    (D)  INCLUDE  DEVELOPMENT  AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE AGENCY'S STRATEGY
   48  AND ACHIEVEMENTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THE STRATEGY AS SIGNIFICANT  ELEMENTS
   49  IN  ANY PERFORMANCE PLANS OF THE AGENCY'S DESIGNATED AGENCY SENIOR-LEVEL
   50  OFFICIAL AND CHIEF ACQUISITION OR PROCUREMENT OFFICER; AND
   51    (E) INCLUDE IN THE AGENCY'S STRATEGY PLANS FOR:
   52    (I) RESERVING AGENCY CONTRACTS EXCLUSIVELY FOR SERVICE-DISABLED VETER-
   53  AN BUSINESSES;
   54    (II) ENCOURAGING AND FACILITATING  PARTICIPATION  BY  SERVICE-DISABLED
   55  VETERAN BUSINESSES IN COMPETITIONS FOR AWARD OF AGENCY CONTRACTS;

       A. 70                               3

    1    (III) ENCOURAGING AGENCY CONTRACTORS TO SUBCONTRACT WITH SERVICE-DISA-
    2  BLED  VETERAN  BUSINESSES  AND ACTIVELY MONITORING AND EVALUATING AGENCY
    3  CONTRACTORS' EFFORTS TO DO SO;
    4    (IV) TRAINING AGENCY PERSONNEL ON APPLICABLE LAW AND POLICIES RELATING
    5  TO   PARTICIPATION  OF  SERVICE-DISABLED  VETERAN  BUSINESSES  IN  STATE
    6  CONTRACTING; AND
    7    (V) DISSEMINATING INFORMATION TO SERVICE-DISABLED  VETERAN  BUSINESSES
    8  THAT  WOULD ASSIST THESE BUSINESSES IN PARTICIPATING IN AWARDS OF AGENCY
    9  CONTRACTS.
   10    5. DUTIES OF DEPUTY COMMISSIONER OF THE DIVISION FOR  SMALL  BUSINESS.
   11  THE  DEPUTY  COMMISSIONER RESPONSIBLE FOR HEADING THE DIVISION FOR SMALL
   12  BUSINESS WITHIN THE DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT,  AS  ESTABLISHED
   13  PURSUANT  TO  SECTION ONE HUNDRED THIRTY-TWO OF THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT
   14  LAW, SHALL:
   15    (A) DESIGNATE AN APPROPRIATE ENTITY  WITHIN  THE  DIVISION  FOR  SMALL
   16  BUSINESS  THAT  SHALL,  IN  COORDINATION  WITH  THE DIVISION OF VETERANS
   17  AFFAIRS AND THE OFFICE OF THE STATE COMPTROLLER, PROVIDE TO SERVICE-DIS-
   18  ABLED VETERAN BUSINESSES INFORMATION AND ASSISTANCE  CONCERNING  PARTIC-
   19  IPATION IN STATE CONTRACTING;
   20    (B)  ADVISE  AND  ASSIST  HEADS OF AGENCIES IN THEIR IMPLEMENTATION OF
   21  SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION;
   22    (C) MAKE AVAILABLE TO SERVICE-DISABLED VETERAN BUSINESSES TRAINING  IN
   23  STATE  CONTRACTING LAW, PROCEDURES, AND PRACTICES THAT WOULD ASSIST SUCH
   24  BUSINESSES IN PARTICIPATING IN STATE CONTRACTING; AND
   25    (D) IN COOPERATION WITH THE CHANCELLOR OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY AND THE
   26  STATE UNIVERSITY, CITY UNIVERSITY AND COMMUNITY COLLEGE SYSTEMS, DEVELOP
   27  A TRAINING PROGRAM ON STATE CONTRACTING  WITH  SERVICE-DISABLED  VETERAN
   28  BUSINESSES  AND MAKE THIS TRAINING AVAILABLE ONLINE THROUGH A CONTINUOUS
   29  LEARNING PROGRAM.
   30    6. DUTIES OF COMMISSIONER OF  THE  OFFICE  OF  GENERAL  SERVICES.  THE
   31  COMMISSIONER OF THE OFFICE OF GENERAL SERVICES, IN COORDINATION WITH THE
   32  OFFICE  OF THE STATE COMPTROLLER AND THE OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL,
   33  SHALL:
   34    (A) ESTABLISH A STATE GOVERNMENT-WIDE  ACQUISITION  CONTRACT  RESERVED
   35  FOR PARTICIPATION BY SERVICE-DISABLED VETERAN BUSINESSES; AND
   36    (B) ASSIST SERVICE-DISABLED VETERAN BUSINESSES TO BE INCLUDED IN STATE
   37  SUPPLY, CONTRACTS AND REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL SCHEDULES.
   38    7.  DUTIES  OF  THE  DIRECTOR OF THE DIVISION OF VETERANS AFFAIRS. THE
   39  DIRECTOR OF THE DIVISION OF VETERANS AFFAIRS SHALL:
   40    (A) ASSIST AGENCIES BY MAKING AVAILABLE SERVICES OF  THE  DIVISION  TO
   41  FACILITATE THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION;
   42    (B) ESTABLISH A REGISTRATION PROGRAM OF SERVICE-DISABLED VETERAN BUSI-
   43  NESSES AND ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A DATABASE WITH REGARD TO SERVICE-DIS-
   44  ABLED VETERAN BUSINESSES, FOR USE BY AGENCIES IN THEIR IMPLEMENTATION OF
   45  THIS SECTION;
   46    (C) ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN, TOGETHER WITH THE COMMISSIONER OF LABOR, A
   47  TRANSITION  ASSISTANCE  PROGRAM  AND  A DISABILITY TRANSITION ASSISTANCE
   48  PROGRAM TO EDUCATE SEPARATING SERVICE MEMBERS AS TO THE BENEFITS  AVAIL-
   49  ABLE  TO  SERVICE-DISABLED VETERAN BUSINESSES AND AS TO POTENTIAL ENTRE-
   50  PRENEURIAL OPPORTUNITIES; AND
   51    (D) DISCLOSE PERSONALLY IDENTIFYING  INFORMATION  ON  SERVICE-DISABLED
   52  VETERANS  TO  OTHER  AGENCIES  WHO  REQUIRE SUCH INFORMATION IN ORDER TO
   53  DISCHARGE THE DIVISION'S RESPONSIBILITIES UNDER THIS SECTION.
   54    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to state contract preference for service disabled veteran owned small businesses
